logic

Class GameConfigurator

  • java.lang.Object
    • logic.GameConfigurator

  • public class GameConfigurator
extends java.lang.Object
    Class responsible for configuring an engine stored such that it contains all entities, components and systems the user desires. This class is also used as a factory for game classes sharing the same engine.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      GameConfigurator(com.badlogic.ashley.core.Engine e)
      constructs game configurator for e with an empty map of balls, no hole set and no systems stored

      Produces count entities using e and adds them to the engine.

      Precondition: there is at least one ball stored and the hole is set.

    • Method Detail

      • entityFactory

        public EntityFactory entityFactory()
        Returns:
        an entity factory fit for use with this game configurator object

      • game

        public Game game()
        Precondition: there is at least one ball stored and the hole is set.
        Returns:
        a new game object. Games constructed by the same game configurator share the same engine.

      • addBall

        public void addBall(Player p,
           Ball b)
        adds a new ball b for player p. Precondition: there are no balls associated with p yet.
        Parameters:
        p - a player object
        b - a ball object

      • setHole

        public void setHole(Hole h)
        sets the hole stored to h
        Parameters:
        h - a hole object

      • addEntities

        public void addEntities(EntityFactory e,
               int count)
        Produces count entities using e and adds them to the engine.
        Parameters:
        e - a factory object producing entities
        count - the number of entities to produce in e
